titleStmt.title: Some remarks upon the present state of the East India Company's affairs with reasons for the speedy establishing a new company to regain that almost lost trade, which is computed to be in value and profit one full sixth part of the trade of the whole kingdom.

Some remarks upon the present state of the East India Company's affairs with reasons for the speedy establishing a new company to regain that almost lost trade, which is computed to be in value and profit one full sixth part of the trade of the whole kingdom.

notesStmt.note: Incomplete: all after p.4 lacking in filmed copy. Best copy available for photographing.
Reproduction of original in the Huntington Library.
